concise_definition: n. 戏弄, 取笑, 挑逗; v. 戏弄, 取笑, 挑逗（tease 的现在分词和动名词形式）

definitions.explanation_en: The act of playfully or mockingly provoking someone, often with humor or light-hearted remarks, without serious intent to harm.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以幽默或戏谑的方式故意挑衅或逗弄某人，通常并无恶意，旨在制造轻松氛围。
definitions.example_en: His teasing about my cooking made everyone laugh, even me.
definitions.example_cn: 他拿我的厨艺开玩笑，逗得大家哈哈大笑，连我自己也笑了。

definitions.explanation_en: A flirtatious or suggestive behavior intended to arouse interest or desire without full commitment.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种带有挑逗意味的行为，旨在引发兴趣或欲望，但并不真正承诺进一步行动。
definitions.example_en: Their constant teasing kept the romantic tension alive throughout the summer.
definitions.example_cn: 他们持续的挑逗让整个夏天的浪漫张力始终未消。

definitions.explanation_en: To make fun of someone in a good-natured or joking way, often among friends or in familiar settings.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以善意或玩笑的方式取笑某人，通常发生在朋友或熟悉的人之间。
definitions.example_en: They teased her about her new haircut, but she knew they meant no harm.
definitions.example_cn: 他们取笑她的新发型，但她知道他们并无恶意。

definitions.explanation_en: To provoke or tantalize someone by offering something desirable but keeping it out of reach.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过提供诱人之物却使其难以获得，来引诱或撩拨某人。
definitions.example_en: The bakery’s smell was teasing me as I walked past, but I couldn’t afford to buy anything.
definitions.example_cn: 我走过面包店时，香味不断撩拨着我，但我买不起任何东西。

comparison.analysis: “Mocking”（嘲讽）带有更强的敌意或贬低意味，常用于公开羞辱或表达轻蔑，而 “teasing” 通常在亲密关系中进行，语气更轻快，不具伤害性。
“Taunting”（挑衅/讥讽）强调以言语或行为激怒对方，常伴随挑衅和敌意，目的是引发愤怒或反应；而 “teasing” 更多是社交互动中的玩笑，通常双方都感到愉快。
“Flirting”（调情）专指为建立浪漫或性吸引力而进行的暗示性互动，其目的明确指向情感或身体吸引；而 “teasing” 可用于非浪漫语境，如朋友间玩笑，其动机更广泛，不一定涉及性吸引力。
